name: src/core/BinaryUtils.js
BinaryUtils
description: A collection of binary number utilities.

name: parseBin
description: Interpretes the given string as a binary number.

params.name: s
params.description: A string that represents a binary number.

name: createBinaryString
description: Creates a binary string representation of the given number.

params.name: minBits
params.description: The minimum length of the string.

name: src/core/index.js
src/core/IntermediateOctant.js
IntermediateOctant
description:
An octant that doesn't reside in level zero.

This octant stores information about the existence of its potential children.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new intermediate octant.

name: children
description:
An 8-bit mask that indicates the existence of the eight potential
children.

The order of the children follows the common octant layout from the
external module `sparse-octree`:

```text
   3____7
 2/___6/|
 | 1__|_5
 0/___4/
```

name: src/core/KeyDesign.js
DWORD_BITS
description: The amount of bits of a DWord.

name: RANGE_DWORD
description: The amount of different values that can be represented with a DWord.

name: BITS
description: The total amount of available bits for safe integers.

name: HI_BITS
description:
The amount of available high bits.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: LO_BITS
description:
The amount of available low bits.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: KeyDesign
description:
A design for octant keys.

3D coordinates are packed into a single integer to obtain a unique key. This
class describes the bit allotment for each coordinate and provides methods
for key packing and unpacking.

See {@link KeyDesign.BITS} for the total amount of available bits.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new key design.

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of bits used for the X-coordinate.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Y-coordinate.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Z-coordinate.

name: x
description: The amount of bits reserved for the X-coordinate.

name: y
description: The amount of bits reserved for the Y-coordinate.

name: z
description: The amount of bits reserved for the Z-coordinate.

name: rangeX
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with X bits.

name: rangeY
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with Y bits.

name: rangeZ
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with Z bits.

name: rangeXY
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with X + Y bits.

name: halfRange
description: The key range divided by two.

name: maskX
description:
A bit mask for the X-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: maskY
description:
A bit mask for the Y-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: maskZ
description:
A bit mask for the Z-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: set
description:
Sets the bit distribution.

Make sure to clear your octree after changing the key design!

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of bits used for the X-coordinate.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Y-coordinate.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Z-coordinate.

name: updateBitMasks
description: Creates bit masks for the extraction of coordinates from keys.

name: unpackKey
description: Extracts the 3D coordinates from a given key.

params.name: target
params.description: A target for the extracted coordinates. If none is provided, a new vector will be created.

name: packKey
description: Packs a 3D position into a unique key.

name: keyRange
description:
Returns a new key range iterator.

The key iterator will return all keys in the specified coordinate range,
including those at min and max.

params.name: min
params.description: The lower key index bounds (zero-based unsigned integer coordinates).

params.name: max
params.description: The upper key index bounds (zero-based unsigned integer coordinates).

name: toString
description: Converts the information of this key design into a string.

return.description: The key design as a string.

name: BITS
description:
The total amount of available bits for safe integers.

JavaScript uses IEEE 754 binary64 Doubles for Numbers and, as a result,
only supports 53-bit integers as of ES2015.

For more information see: http://2ality.com/2012/04/number-encoding.html

name: HI_BITS
description:
The amount of available bits in the high DWord.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: LO_BITS
description:
The amount of available bits in the low DWord.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: src/core/Octant.js
Octant
description:
An octant.

This octant serves as a data container. Its position is implicitly defined
by its key and its size is defined by the level in which it resides.

name: src/core/Octree.js
v
description: A vector.

name: removeChildren
description: Recursively deletes octant children.

params.name: keyX
params.description: The X-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyY
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyZ
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyX

params.name: keyY
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the deleted octant's key.

params.name: keyZ
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the deleted octant's key.

name: Octree
description:
An octree that subdivides space for fast spatial searches.

This linear implementation offers constant time access to octants at any
depth level as well as octant neighbours and parents.

name: constructor
description:
Constructs a new octree.

Each octant can be uniquely identified by a 3D coordinate and a level.
The individual values for X, Y and Z are packed into a numeric key.

params.name: cellSize
params.description: The size of the smallest octants in level zero. Must be an integer i such that 0 < i < 2 ** (33 - levels).

params.name: levels
params.description: The amount of detail levels. Must be an integer i such that 0 < i < 33.

params.name: keyDesign
params.description: The bit allotments for the octant coordinates.

name: cellSize
description: The level zero cell size.

name: keyDesign
description: The octant key design.

name: grids
description: The octant level grids.

name: bounds
description: An empty octant wrapper that holds the bounds of this octree.

name: min
description: The lower bounds of this octree.

name: max
description: The upper bounds of this octree.

name: levels
description: The amount of depth levels. This value can not be changed.

name: levelZero
description: The level zero octant grid.

name: getKeyDesign
description: Returns the key design.

name: getCellSize
description: Returns the size of the cells in the specified grid.

params.name: level
params.description: The level. Must be a positive integer.

name: getCenter
description: Calculates the center of this octree.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the center of this octree.

name: setCenter
description: Sets the center of this octree.

name: getDimensions
description: Computes the size of this octree.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the size of this octree.

name: getGrid
description: Returns the grid of the specified level.

return.description: The requested grid or undefined if the given level is out of bounds.

name: clear
description: Removes all octants.

name: containsPoint
description: Checks if the given point lies inside this octree's boundaries.

return.description: Whether the given point lies inside this octree.

name: getDepth
description: Returns the octree depth.

return.description: The octree depth. This value is constant.

name: findNodesByLevel
description: Fetches all nodes of the specified level.

return.description: A collection that contains the nodes of the specified level.

name: calculateKeyCoordinates
description: Calculates key coordinates based on a given position and level.

params.name: target
params.description: A vector to store the result in. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

name: getNodeByPoint
description: Retrieves the node of a specific level that contains the given point.

return.description: The node that contains the point or undefined if it doesn't exist.

name: remove
description:
Removes a specific node by a given key.

Children and empty parent nodes will be removed as well.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the octant that should be removed.

name: raycast
description:
Finds the nodes that intersect with the given ray. The intersecting
nodes are sorted by distance, closest first. Empty nodes will not be
included in the result.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting nodes.

name: octants
description:
Returns a new octree octant iterator.

The octants returned by this iterator are augmented with explicit
positional information. See {@link OctantWrapper} for more details.

name: calculateOffsetIndex
description:
Calculates an offset index from octant key coordinates.

The index identifies the octant's positional offset relative to its parent:

```text
 0: [0, 0, 0]
 1: [0, 0, 1]
 2: [0, 1, 0]
 3: [0, 1, 1]
 4: [1, 0, 0]
 5: [1, 0, 1]
 6: [1, 1, 0]
 7: [1, 1, 1]
```

Note: This binary layout is defined in the external module `sparse-octree`.

For more information on fast bitwise modulo with power of two divisors see:
 https://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html#ModulusDivisionEasy

params.name: x
params.description: The X-coordinate of the octant key.

params.name: y
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the octant key.

params.name: z
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the octant key.

return.description: The index of the relative positional offset. Range: [0, 7].

name: octree

name: iterator

name: octantWrapper
description: A octant wrapper.

name: result
description: An iterator result.

name: reset
description: Resets this iterator.

name: next
description: Iterates over the octants.

name: return
description: Called when this iterator will no longer be run to completion.

name: src/core/OctreeRaycaster.js
flags
description: Raycasting flags.

name: v
description: A vector.

name: l
description: A line.

name: r
description: A ray.

name: raycastOctant
description:
Recursively traverses the given octant to find (pseudo) leaf octants that
intersect with the given ray.

params.name: keyX
params.description: The X-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyY
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyZ
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting octants.

name: OctreeRaycaster
description:
A raycaster for linear octrees.

This raycaster is a specialized hybrid that uses a voxel traversal algorithm
to iterate over the octants of the highest LOD grid and an octree traversal
algorithm to raycast the identified subtrees.

The voxel traversal implementation is a 3D supercover variant of the Digital
Differential Analyzer (DDA) line algorithm and is similar to the Bresenham
algorithm. The octree traversal algorithm uses octant child existence
information to skip empty space and avoids hash table lookup misses.

References:
 "Voxel Traversal along a 3D Line"
 by D. Cohen (1994)
 "An Efficient Parametric Algorithm for Octree Traversal"
 by J. Revelles et al. (2000)

name: intersectOctree
description: Finds (pseudo) leaf octants that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting octants.

return.description: The intersecting octants. Sorted by distance, closest first.

name: src/index.js
content:
export {
	IntermediateOctant,
	KeyDesign,
	KeyIterator,
	Octant,
	OctantId,
	OctantWrapper,
	Octree,
	OctreeIterator,
	OctreeRaycaster
} from "./core";

# Linear Octree

[![Build status](https://travis-ci.org/vanruesc/linear-octree.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/vanruesc/linear-octree)
[![npm version](https://badgen.net/npm/v/linear-octree?color=green)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/linear-octree)
[![Peer dependencies](https://david-dm.org/vanruesc/linear-octree/peer-status.svg)](https://david-dm.org/vanruesc/linear-octree?type=peer)

:warning: WIP :warning:

A sparse, linear octree data structure. For a pointer-based implementation see [sparse-octree](https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree).

*[Demo](https://vanruesc.github.io/linear-octree/public/demo) · [Documentation](https://vanruesc.github.io/linear-octree/public/docs)*


## Installation

This library requires the peer dependencies [iterator-result](https://github.com/vanruesc/iterator-result) and [math-ds](https://github.com/vanruesc/math-ds).

```sh
npm install iterator-result math-ds
``` 

```sh
npm install linear-octree
``` 


## Usage

##### Objects

```js
import { Octree } from "linear-octree";

// TODO
```


## Features

- Linear structure
  - Packs positional data into numeric keys
  - Constant time access to octants, parents and neighbors at any depth level
  - Low memory usage
  - Constant depth
- Adheres to a [common octant layout](http://vanruesc.github.io/sparse-octree/public/docs/variable/index.html#static-variable-layout)
- Supports raycasting
  - Uses a 3D supercover variant of the [DDA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_differential_analyzer_(graphics_algorithm)) line algorithm
- Supports culling
- Can be extended to manage any data


## Octree Helper

The [octree-helper](https://github.com/vanruesc/octree-helper) module provides an octree visualization tool for [three.js](https://threejs.org/).


## Contributing

Maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
	"name": "linear-octree",
	"version": "0.0.0",
	"description": "A sparse, linear octree data structure.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/vanruesc/linear-octree",
	"main": "build/linear-octree.js",
	"module": "build/linear-octree.esm.js",
	"sideEffects": false,
	"license": "Zlib",

	"keywords": [
		"partition",
		"hierarchy",
		"subdivision",
		"raycasting",
		"3d",
		"spatial",
		"voxel",
		"points",
		"frustum",
		"culling",
		"linear"
	],

	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},

	"repository": {
		"type": "git",
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/linear-octree.git"
	},

	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/linear-octree/issues"
	},

	"files": ["build"],

	"scripts": {
		"ava": "ava",
		"lint": "npm run lint:lib && npm run lint:demo",
		"lint:config": "eslint *.js",
		"lint:lib": "eslint src",
		"lint:demo": "eslint demo/src",
		"lint:test": "eslint test",
		"build": "rollup -c",
		"build:production": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production npm run build",
		"watch": "rollup -c --watch",
		"doc": "rimraf public/docs && esdoc",
		"pretest": "npm run lint && npm run build:production",
		"test": "",
		"prepack": "npm test"
	},

	"ava": {
		"failFast": true,
		"files": ["test/**/*.js"]
	},

	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "delta"
	},

	"dependencies": {
		"sparse-octree": "6.x.x"
	},

	"peerDependencies": {
		"iterator-result": ">= 0.0.0 < 1.0.0",
		"math-ds": ">= 1.0.0 < 2.0.0"
	},

	"devDependencies": {
		"@babel/core": "7.x.x",
		"@babel/preset-env": "7.x.x",
		"ava": "2.x.x",
		"cross-env": "6.x.x",
		"dat.gui": "0.x.x",
		"delta-controls": "2.x.x",
		"esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-importpath-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint": "6.x.x",
		"eslint-config-delta": "1.x.x",
		"iterator-result": "0.x.x",
		"math-ds": "1.x.x",
		"rimraf": "3.x.x",
		"octree-helper": "1.x.x",
		"rollup": "1.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel": "4.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel-minify": "9.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "5.x.x",
		"synthetic-event": "1.x.x",
		"three": "0.x.x",
		"three-demo": "3.x.x"
	}
}
